articles.title: Disney Pixar Luxo Jr. Lego Set On Sale For The First Time At Amazon
articles.summary: Lego Ideas: Disney Pixar Luxo Jr. (613 Pieces)                                                                                            $63 (was $70)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       See at Amazon                                                                    Pixar fans can save 10% on Lego's 613-piece model of Luxo Jr. and the Pixar Ball. Normally $70, Lego Ideas: Disney Pixar Luxo Jr. is on sale for $63. Lego's recreation of the iconic Pixar mascot launched last June and has rarely budged from its MSRP. The current discount is the best we've seen for the set, but it's not marked as an official deal. Over the past few weeks, Luxo Jr.'s price on Amazon has sometimes changed multiple times in a single day, so we wouldn't be surprised if the the price has changed again by the time you read this story.                                                                                                        Lego Ideas: Disney Pixar Luxo Jr. (613 Pieces)                                                                $63 (was $70)                                                                                                                                                                                                                      The 613-piece replica of Luxo Jr. measures 5.5 x 4 x 11 inches--though Luxo Jr.'s height varies based on how you pose it. Luxo Jr. can stand next to the buildable Pixar Ball or balance on top of it by making a couple of simple adjustments.Lego designed Luxo Jr. as a fully articulated model capable of being displayed in poses from the iconic Pixar production logo and short film starring the semi-anthropomorphic lamp. The light bulb doesn't actually work, but Lego did a good job of making it look realistic.As a Lego model, Luxo Jr. is quite different than the vast majority of Disney Pixar building sets. Designed for experienced builders and collectors, the model has an interesting build process thanks to its multi-hinged arm, modifiable base, and the many Easter Eggs Lego worked into the authentic recreation.There are dozens of references to Pixar movies hidden throughout the Luxo Jr. and Pixar Ball builds. For instance, the Pizza Planet truck from the first Toy Story movie is included inside the light bulb. The lamp's base has a miniature build referencing Marlin & Dory from Finding Nemo as well as clever allusions to Inside Out, Cars, Coco, WALL-E, A Bug's Life--and possibly others that we missed.The instruction booklet calls out the Finding Nemo character builds as well as the mini-builds found in the Pixar Ball. The interior of the colorful ball features multiple characters from five different Pixar movies:Toy Story - Woody & BuzzUp - Carl & RussellMonsters, Inc. - Mike & SullyThe Incredibles familyRatatouille - Linguini & RemyAs mentioned, one of the display modes is Luxo Jr. "deflating" the toy ball, just like in the production logo's animation sequence. Once you remove two of the rounded plates from the ball, Luxo Jr. can connect to the top. It's a quick and easy modification. The Pixar Ball has its own buildable stand, so the model still feels stable with Luxo Jr. on the ball.                                                        See at Amazon                                                                                 Lego Ideas: Disney Pixar Luxo Jr. (21357) Luxo Jr. was the star of Pixar's first short film in 1986. It was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Animated Short, but most Pixar fans were introduced to the character when it hopped across the screen to complete the Pixar logo at the beginning of Toy Story in 1995. The short film originally only played at film festivals and conventions, but it eventually played in theaters worldwide before screenings of Toy Story 2 in 1999.  Continue Reading at GameSpot
articles.long_summary: Lego Ideas: Disney Pixar Luxo Jr. (613 Pieces)                                                                                            $63 (was $70)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       See at Amazon                                                                    Pixar fans can save 10% on Lego's 613

articles.title: War has pushed Gaza’s children to the brink – “like the living dead”
articles.summary: A new study warns that war in Gaza has pushed children to the edge, leaving many too hungry, weak, or traumatized to learn. Education has nearly collapsed, with years of schooling lost to conflict, hunger, and fear. Researchers say children are losing faith in the future and in basic ideas like peace and human rights. Without urgent aid, Gaza faces the risk of a lost generation.
articles.long_summary: A new study warns that war in Gaza has pushed children to the edge, leaving many too hungry, weak, or traumatized to learn. Education has nearly collapsed, with years of schooling lost to conflict, hunger, and fear. Researchers say children are losing faith in the future and in basic ideas like peace and human rights. Without urgent aid, Gaza faces the risk of a lost generation.

articles.title: A massive gene hunt reveals how brain cells are made
articles.summary: A large genetic screen has revealed how stem cells transform into brain cells, exposing hundreds of genes that make this process possible. Among the discoveries is PEDS1, a gene now linked to a previously unknown neurodevelopmental disorder in children. When PEDS1 does not work properly, brain growth and nerve cell formation are impaired. The findings help explain how early genetic changes can shape brain development and disease.
articles.long_summary: A large genetic screen has revealed how stem cells transform into brain cells, exposing hundreds of genes that make this process possible. Among the discoveries is PEDS1, a gene now linked to a previously unknown neurodevelopmental disorder in children. When PEDS1 does not work properly, brain growth and nerve cell formation are impaired. The findings help explain how early genetic changes can shape brain development and disease.

articles.title: 1408 Amazon-Exclusive 4K Steelbook Edition Releases This Week
articles.summary: 1408 Limited Edition Steelbook (4K Blu-ray)                                                                                            $40 | Amazon Exclusive | Releases January 13                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       See at Amazon                                                                    Another Stephen King adaptation lands on 4K Blu-ray for the first time this week. 1408, the 2007 psychological horror movie starring John Cusack and Samuel L. Jackson, releases January 13 exclusively at Amazon for $40. 1408 Limited Edition Steelbook is a three-disc set with theatrical and extended cuts of the hit film. The collectible steelbook case and slipcover have awesome original artwork; it's honestly one of the best-designed 4K Blu-ray editions of a Stephen King movie you can buy today.Based on a 1999 short story by Stephen King, 1408 follows Mike Enslin, a grief-stricken author who investigates and writes places that are allegedly haunted. His latest investigation brings him to room 1408 at the NYC hotel The Dolphin. 1408 was a pretty big hit at the box office and features terrific performances by Cusack and Jackson.                                                                                                        1408 Limited Edition Steelbook (4K Blu-ray)                                                                $40 | Amazon Exclusive | Releases January 13                                                                                                                                                                                                                      The Amazon-exclusive Limited Edition Steelbook is a three-disc set with two 4K Blu-rays and one 1080p Blu-ray. Fans can watch the original theatrical edition on 4K as well as the Director's Cut on 4K and 1080p. The Director's Cut (112m) is approximately eight minutes longer than the theatrical release (104m).The upscaled 4K Blu-ray editions support Dolby Vision and HDR10. Audio formats include Dolby Atmos and Dolby TrueHD 5.1/7.1 surround sound.The two Director's Cut discs have the special features from previous Blu-ray editions, including the three alternate endings. The theatrical 4K Blu-ray disc also has a brand-new featurette titled Don't Enter 1408. The exclusive steelbook case features new artwork by graphic designer Gary Pullin (Ghoulish Gary). The front of the case is a rendering of the door to the eponymous hotel room, while the back features protagonist Mike Enslin's daughter Katie with manuscript pages floating around her and the name of the hotel (The Dolphin). The interior artwork recreates the memorable scene inside the torn apart hotel room where Mike sinks to his knees and reaches out toward Katie. The slipcover features a stylized and modified version of the original promotional image featuring Cusack and Jackson. The new artwork looks fantastic, and it'd be great to see more limited-edition steelbooks opt for a more creative design like Lionsgate has here.1408 Amazon Exclusive Edition Features:Exclusive steelbook caseExclusive slipcover2 Cuts / 3 Discs  Theatrical (4K)Director's (4K & 1080p)Upscaled 4K (2160p)HDR: Dolby Vision / HDR10Audio: Dolby Atmos / Dolby TrueHD 5.1/7.1Special Features:Don't Enter 1408 featurette (New)Audio commentary with director Mikael Håfström and writers Scott Alexander and Larry KaraszewskiAlternate endingsDeleted scenes with optional commentaryThe Secrets of 1408 (22 minutes)  Behind-the-scenes look at the making of 1408. Split into four parts.Inside Room 1408 featuretteJohn Cusack on 1408 featuretteTheatrical trailer                                                        See at Amazon                                                                                 1408 Limited Edition Steelbook (4K Blu-ray) - Amazon Exclusive Edition                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Stephen King Adaptations on 4K Blu-ray                                                                                            All movies and shows fans can buy and preorder today.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       See at Amazon                                                                     Continue Reading at GameSpot
articles.long_summary: 1408 Limited Edition Steelbook (4K Blu-ray)                                                                                            $40 | Amazon Exclusive | Releases January 13                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       See at Amazon                                                                    Another S

articles.title: Nintendo's New Joy-Con 2 Controller Set Is Up For Preorder At Amazon
articles.summary: Nintendo Joy-Con 2 Light Purple/Green Set                                                                                            $100 | Releases February 12                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Preorder at Amazon                                                                                                                                                                           Preorder at Best Buy                                                                                                                                                                           Preorder at Target                                                                                                                                                                           Preorder at GameStop                                                                                                                                                                           Preorder at Nintendo                                                                     The newly announced Light Purple and Light Green Joy-Con 2 Controllers for Nintendo Switch 2 are available to preorder at major retailers, including Amazon, Best Buy, Target, and GameStop. Just like the Light Blue/Red Joy-Con 2 bundled with the Switch 2 console, the upcoming controllers are black with colorful accents. Both controllers come with matching wrist straps that can also be used for mouse controls.The Light Purple/Green Joy-Con 2 set releases February 12, the same day as Mario Tennis Fever, which supports single Joy-Con motion controls for up to four players on one console. It's worth noting that Amazon-owned retailer Woot has the Light Blue/Red Joy-Con 2 for $90 (was $100) as part of its Video Game Mega Sale.Continue Reading at GameSpot
articles.long_summary: Nintendo Joy-Con 2 Light Purple/Green Set                                                                                            $100 | Releases February 12                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Preorder at Amazon
